description: Borrowed from Italian sdrucciola (feminine form of sdrucciolo (“slippery; stressed on the antepenult”)).

entries.meaning: (rare, prosody, of a rhyme) Formed of words stressed on their antepenults and rhyming on all three final syllables.
examples: Note that ending that couplet’s lines with the words ‘reparate’ and ‘separate’ would create a rhyme sdrucciola, if that helps.
